configuration.name: preprocessScript
initScript
configuration.value:
# Available Objects:
#
#  sdc.state: a dict that is preserved between invocations of this script.
#         Useful for caching bits of data e.g. counters.
#  sdc.log.<loglevel>(msg, obj...): use instead of print to send log messages to the log4j log instead of stdout.
#                               loglevel is any log4j level: e.g. info, error, warn, trace.
#  sdc.getFieldNull(Record, 'field path'): Receive a constant defined above
#                                  to check if the field is typed field with value null
#  sdc.createMap(boolean listMap): Create a map for use as a field in a record.
#                            Pass True to this function to create a list map (ordered map).
#  sdc.createEvent(String type, int version): Creates a new event.
#                            Create new empty event with standard headers.
#  sdc.createMap(boolean listMap): Create a map for use as a field in a record.
#                            Pass True to this function to create a list map (ordered map).
#

# sdc.state['connection'] = new Connection().open()

configuration.name: script
destroyScript
configuration.value:
# Available Objects:
#
#  sdc.state: a dict that is preserved between invocations of this script.
#         Useful for caching bits of data e.g. counters.
#  sdc.log.<loglevel>(msg, obj...): use instead of print to send log messages to the log4j log instead of stdout.
#                               loglevel is any log4j level: e.g. info, error, warn, trace.
#  sdc.getFieldNull(Record, 'field path'): Receive a constant defined above 
#                                  to check if the field is typed field with value null.
#  sdc.createMap(boolean listMap): Create a map for use as a field in a record.
#                            Pass True to this function to create a list map (ordered map).
#  sdc.createEvent(String type, int version): Creates a new event.
#                            Create new empty event with standard headers.
#  sdc.toEvent(Record): Send event to event stream.
#                            Only events created with sdcFunctions.createEvent are supported.
#

# sdc.state['connection'].close()

stages.description: Reads MySQL binary log from MySQL server.
stages.label: MySQL Binary Log

configDefinitions.description: ServerId used by binlog client. Must be unique among all replication slaves (origin acts as a replication slave itself).
configDefinitions.label: Server ID
configDefinitions.name: config.serverId

configDefinitions.description: Maximum number of records in a batch.
configDefinitions.label: Max Batch Size (records)
configDefinitions.name: config.maxBatchSize

configDefinitions.description: Maximum timeout millis to wait for batch records before returning incomplete or empty batch.
configDefinitions.label: Batch Wait Time (ms)
configDefinitions.name: config.maxWaitTime

configDefinitions.description: MySql connection timeout millis.
configDefinitions.label: Connect Timeout (ms)
configDefinitions.name: config.connectTimeout

configDefinitions.description: Whether keepAlive thread should be automatically started
configDefinitions.label: Enable KeepAlive Thread
configDefinitions.name: config.enableKeepAlive

configDefinitions.description: Keep Alive interval in milliseconds. 1 minute by default
configDefinitions.label: KeepAlive Interval (ms)
configDefinitions.name: config.keepAliveInterval

configDefinitions.description: On first origin start read events from beginning of binlog. When 'false' - start from current binlog position. In case when GTID-enabled this records all server executed gtids as applied.
configDefinitions.label: Start From Beginning
configDefinitions.name: config.startFromBeginning

configDefinitions.description: On first origin start read events starting from given offset. Offset format depends on GTID mode. When GTID is enabled - it should be a GTID-set of transactions that should be skipped. When GTID is disabled - it should be binlog filename + binlog position to start from in format '${binlog-filename}:${binlog-position}'. Note - this setting conflicts with 'Start from beginning' setting, if both are set - this takes precedence.
configDefinitions.label: Initial offset
configDefinitions.name: config.initialOffset

configDefinitions.description: Comma-delimited list of database and table names to include. Database and table names support wildcards - special character '%' match any number of any chars. DB and table name are delimited by dot. Example - 'db%sales.sales_%_dep,db2.orders'. All tables that are not included are ignored.
configDefinitions.label: Include Tables
configDefinitions.name: config.includeTables

configDefinitions.description: Comma-delimited list of database and table names to ignore. Database and table names support wildcards - special character '%' match any number of any chars. DB and table name are delimited by dot. Example - 'db%sales.sales_%_dep,db2.orders'. Ignore tables have precedence over include tables - if some table is both included and ignored - it will be ignored.
configDefinitions.label: Ignore Tables
configDefinitions.name: config.ignoreTables

configDefinitions.description: Action to take with records sent to error
configDefinitions.label: On Record Error
configDefinitions.name: stageOnRecordError

stages.name: com_streamsets_pipeline_stage_origin_mysql_MysqlDSource

configDefinitions.description: If 'Record by Record' the processor takes care of record error handling, if 'Record batch' the Jython script must take care of record error handling
configDefinitions.label: Record Processing Mode
configDefinitions.name: processingMode

configDefinitions.description: Place initialization code here. Called on pipeline validate/start.
configDefinitions.label: Init Script
configDefinitions.name: initScript
configDefinitions.defaultValue:
# Available Objects:
#
#  sdc.state: a dict that is preserved between invocations of this script.
#         Useful for caching bits of data e.g. counters.
#  sdc.log.<loglevel>(msg, obj...): use instead of print to send log messages to the log4j log instead of stdout.
#                               loglevel is any log4j level: e.g. info, error, warn, trace.
#  sdc.getFieldNull(Record, 'field path'): Receive a constant defined above
#                                  to check if the field is typed field with value null
#  sdc.createMap(boolean listMap): Create a map for use as a field in a record.
#                            Pass True to this function to create a list map (ordered map).
#  sdc.createEvent(String type, int version): Creates a new event.
#                            Create new empty event with standard headers.
#  sdc.createMap(boolean listMap): Create a map for use as a field in a record.
#                            Pass True to this function to create a list map (ordered map).
#

# sdc.state['connection'] = new Connection().open()

configDefinitions.label: Script
configDefinitions.name: script
configDefinitions.defaultValue:
# Available constants: 
#   They are to assign a type to a field with a value null.
#   sdc.NULL_BOOLEAN, sdc.NULL_CHAR, sdc.NULL_BYTE, sdc.NULL_SHORT, sdc.NULL_INTEGER, sdc.NULL_LONG,
#   sdc.NULL_FLOAT, sdc.NULL_DOUBLE, sdc.NULL_DATE, sdc.NULL_DATETIME, sdc.NULL_TIME, sdc.NULL_DECIMAL,
#   sdc.NULL_BYTE_ARRAY, sdc.NULL_STRING, sdc.NULL_LIST, sdc.NULL_MAP
# 
# Available Objects:
# 
#  sdc.records: an array of records to process, depending on Jython processor
#           processing mode it may have 1 record or all the records in the batch.
#
#  sdc.state: a dict that is preserved between invocations of this script. 
#         Useful for caching bits of data e.g. counters.
#
#  sdc.log.<loglevel>(msg, obj...): use instead of print to send log messages to the log4j log instead of stdout.
#                               loglevel is any log4j level: e.g. info, error, warn, trace.
#
#  sdc.output.write(record): writes a record to processor output
#
#  sdc.error.write(record, message): sends a record to error
#
#  sdc.getFieldNull(Record, 'field path'): Receive a constant defined above 
#                                  to check if the field is typed field with value null
#  sdc.createRecord(String recordId): Creates a new record.
#                            Pass a recordId to uniquely identify the record and include enough information to track down the record source. 
#  sdc.createMap(boolean listMap): Create a map for use as a field in a record.
#                            Pass True to this function to create a list map (ordered map)
#
#  sdc.createEvent(String type, int version): Creates a new event.
#                            Create new empty event with standard headers.
#  sdc.toEvent(Record): Send event to event stream
#                            Only events created with sdcFunctions.createEvent are supported.
#  sdc.isPreview(): Determine if pipeline is in preview mode.
#
#  sdc.userParams: Dictionary of user-specified keys and values (from UI).
#
#
# Available Record Header Variables:
#
#  record.attributes: a map of record header attributes.
#
#  record.<header name>: get the value of 'header name'.
#
# Add additional module search paths:
#   try:
#       sdc.importLock()
#       import sys
#       sys.path.append('/some/other/dir/to/search')
#       import something
#   finally:
#       sdc.importUnlock()
#

# Sample Jython code
for record in sdc.records:
  try:
    # Change record root field value to a STRING value
    # record.value = 'Hello '


    # Change record root field value to a MAP value and create an entry
    # record.value = { 'V' : 'Hello'}

    # Access a MAP entry
    # record.value['X'] = record.value['V'] + ' World'

    # Modify a MAP entry
    # record.value['V'] = 5

    # Create an ARRAY entry
    # record.value['A'] = [ 'Element 1', 'Element 2' ]

    # Access an ARRAY entry
    # record.value['B'] = record.value['A'][0]

    # Modify an existing ARRAY entry
    # record.value['A'][0] = 100

    # Assign a integer type to a field and value null
    # record.value['null_int'] = sdc.NULL_INTEGER 

    # Check if the field is NULL_INTEGER(Both '==' and 'is' work). If so, assign a value 
    # if sdc.getFieldNull(record, '/null_int') == sdc.NULL_INTEGER:
    #    record.value['null_int'] = 123

    # Direct access to the underlying Data Collector Record. Use for read-only operations.
    # fieldAttr = record.sdcRecord.get('/value').getAttribute('attr')  

    # Create a new record with map field 
    # newRecord = sdc.createRecord(record.sourceId + ':newRecordId')
    # newRecord.value = {'field1' : 'val1', 'field2' : 'val2'}
    # sdc.output.write(newRecord)

    # Applies if the source uses WHOLE_FILE as data format
    # input_stream = record.value['fileRef'].getInputStream()
    # try:
    #   input_stream.read() #Process the input stream
    # finally:  
    #   input_stream.close()

    # Modify a record header attribute entry
    # record.attributes['name'] = record.attributes['first_name'] + ' ' + record.attributes['last_name']

    # Get a record header with field names ex. get sourceId and errorCode
    # sourceId = record.sourceId
    # errorCode = ''
    # if record.errorCode:
    #   errorCode = record.errorCode

    # Write record to processor output
    sdc.output.write(record)

  except Exception as e:
    # Send record to error
    sdc.error.write(record, str(e))

configDefinitions.description: Place cleanup code here. Called on pipeline stop.
configDefinitions.label: Destroy Script
configDefinitions.name: destroyScript
configDefinitions.defaultValue:
# Available Objects:
#
#  sdc.state: a dict that is preserved between invocations of this script.
#         Useful for caching bits of data e.g. counters.
#  sdc.log.<loglevel>(msg, obj...): use instead of print to send log messages to the log4j log instead of stdout.
#                               loglevel is any log4j level: e.g. info, error, warn, trace.
#  sdc.getFieldNull(Record, 'field path'): Receive a constant defined above 
#                                  to check if the field is typed field with value null.
#  sdc.createMap(boolean listMap): Create a map for use as a field in a record.
#                            Pass True to this function to create a list map (ordered map).
#  sdc.createEvent(String type, int version): Creates a new event.
#                            Create new empty event with standard headers.
#  sdc.toEvent(Record): Send event to event stream.
#                            Only events created with sdcFunctions.createEvent are supported.
#

# sdc.state['connection'].close()

configDefinitions.description: When checked, configured string constant will be converted into NULL field.

configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.nullConstant

configDefinitions.description: XML element that acts as a record delimiter.  This may be an element name, with elements having that local name directly under the root as records.  Or, it can be a simplified XPath expression (see docs), with elements matching the XPath expression as records.  Leaving it blank will treat the whole XML document as one record.
configDefinitions.label: Delimiter Element
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.xmlRecordElement

configDefinitions.description: Include the root element in the output records. The root element is the last element defined in the record element delimiter or is the root element of the XML document when no delimiter is defined
configDefinitions.label: Preserve Root Element
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.preserveRootElement

configDefinitions.description: Include XPath expressions that indicate the path to the input node that was parsed to create each field.  If enabled, each field will receive an attribute named "xpath" whose value is the XPath expression.  Any namespace prefixes will be mapped to the full URI via new xmlns:* attributes in the record header.
configDefinitions.label: Include Field XPaths
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.includeFieldXpathAttributes

configDefinitions.description: Namespace context to use if the delimiter is an XPath expression.  This should map namespace prefixes to URIs.  Any namespace prefix that is used in the record separator expression must be defined here.
configDefinitions.label: Namespaces
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.xPathNamespaceContext

configDefinitions.description: Generate field attributes in output record for XML namespace declarations, and XML attributes.  Without this option, they will continue to be output as individual fields (separate from the element value).
configDefinitions.label: Output Field Attributes
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.outputFieldAttributes

configDefinitions.description: Larger records are not processed
configDefinitions.label: Max Record Length (chars)
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.xmlMaxObjectLen

configDefinitions.description: Longer lines are truncated
configDefinitions.label: Max Line Length

configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.regex

configDefinitions.description: Map groups in the regular expression to field paths
configDefinitions.label: Field Path To RegEx Group Mapping
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.fieldPathsToGroupName

configDefinitions.description: Define your own grok patterns which will be used to parse the logs

configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.grokPatternDefinition

configDefinitions.label: Grok Pattern
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.grokPattern

configDefinitions.description: Specify your own custom log4j format.

configDefinitions.description: Converts high resolution time format interval and timestamp to unix time in (ms).

configDefinitions.description: Excludes the interval field from output records.

configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.excludeInterval

configDefinitions.description: Determines the data that is included in the record generated from a flow. Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.label: Record Generation Mode
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.netflowOutputValuesMode

configDefinitions.description: Controls the maximum number of templates to cache from all sources. Additional templates received when this limit is reached cause the eviction of existing templates, least recently used first. Leave as -1 for unlimited. Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.label: Max Templates in Cache
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.maxTemplateCacheSize

configDefinitions.description: Controls the maximum length of time flow templates are cached, after last being used to parse a data flow. Leave as -1 for unlimited (never expires). Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.label: Template Cache Timeout (ms)
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.templateCacheTimeoutMs

configDefinitions.description: Determines the data that is included in the record generated from a flow. Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.label: Record Generation Mode
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.netflowOutputValuesModeDatagram

configDefinitions.description: Controls the maximum number of templates to cache from all sources. Additional templates received when this limit is reached cause the eviction of existing templates, least recently used first. Leave as -1 for unlimited. Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.label: Max Templates in Cache
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.maxTemplateCacheSizeDatagram

configDefinitions.description: Controls the maximum length of time flow templates are cached, after last being used to parse a data flow. Leave as -1 for unlimited (never expires). Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.label: Template Cache Timeout (ms)
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.templateCacheTimeoutMsDatagram

configDefinitions.description: Size of the Buffer used to copy the file.
configDefinitions.label: Buffer Size (bytes)
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.wholeFileMaxObjectLen

configDefinitions.description: Rate / sec to manipulate bandwidth requirements for File Transfer. Use <= 0 to opt out. Default unit is B/sec

configDefinitions.description: When checked verifies the checksum of the stream during read.
configDefinitions.label: Verify Checksum

configDefinitions.label: Excel Header Option

configDefinitions.description: If checked, cells that have no associated header value will be skipped.
configDefinitions.label: Skip Cells With No Header

configDefinitions.description: If checked, cells that have empty value will be included.
